hero.title: Who is
hero.subtitle: Ofra was born from a simple observation: New Brunswick real estate agents deserve a modern, bilingual tool built for their reality.

mission.title: Our mission
mission.p1: In New Brunswick, real estate agents juggle dozens of conditions, critical deadlines, and demanding FINTRAC regulations — often with tools that weren't built for them.
mission.p2: Ofra exists to eliminate oversights, reduce stress, and give agents back the time to do what they do best: guide their clients toward the perfect transaction.
mission.quote: Every agent should sleep soundly knowing nothing slips through the cracks.

problem.title: The problem we solve
problem.subtitle: Too many agents lose time and money because of tools that don't fit New Brunswick's reality.

pain1.desc: Missed inspections, untracked financing — every oversight can cost an entire transaction.

pain2.title: Complex compliance

faq.q1: How many Founder spots are left?
faq.a1: The program is limited to 25 spots. Once all 25 are taken, the program closes permanently. Remaining spots are shown in real time on this page.
faq.q2: What does 'lifetime price lock' mean exactly?
faq.a2: The price you pay on the day you subscribe will never change. If you're on the Pro plan at $79/month and we raise it to $99/month in the future, you stay at $79/month — forever.
faq.q3: Can I change plans as a Founder?
faq.a3: Yes. If you upgrade, you get the current price of that plan, which is also locked for life. If you downgrade, you keep the price of the lower plan as it was when you first signed up.
faq.q4: Is the free trial included for Founders?
faq.a4: Absolutely. You get the same 30-day free trial with all Pro features. The price locks when you choose your paid plan.
faq.q5: How do I know it's really limited to 25 spots?
faq.a5: The counter on this page is connected in real time to our database. When it shows 0 spots remaining, the program closes automatically. It's a firm commitment, not a marketing tactic.

hero.title: Frequently asked questions
hero.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Ofra. Can't find your answer? Contact us.

general.a1: Ofra is a real estate transaction management software designed specifically for New Brunswick agents. It covers the complete workflow from consultation to post-closing, with automated conditions, offer management, and built-in FINTRAC compliance.
general.a2: Ofra is currently optimized for the New Brunswick market (specific conditions, provincial regulations, FR/EN bilingualism). We plan to expand coverage to other provinces in the future.
general.q3: Does Ofra replace my current CRM?
general.a3: Ofra is not a generic CRM — it's a transaction tracking tool. It focuses on the workflow of each individual transaction (conditions, offers, documents, steps). It complements your existing CRM rather than replacing it.
general.q4: What languages is Ofra available in?
general.a4: Ofra is 100% bilingual French and English. You can switch languages with one click from your profile, and the entire interface adapts instantly.

trial.q1: How does the free trial work?
trial.a1: You get 30 days free with all Pro plan features. No credit card required to start. At the end of the trial, you choose the plan that fits your practice.
trial.q2: What happens at the end of the trial?
trial.a2: After 30 days, you choose a paid plan to continue. Your data and transactions are preserved. If you don't choose a plan, your account remains accessible in read-only mode.
trial.q3: Can I cancel during the trial?
trial.a3: Absolutely. You can cancel at any time during the trial with no charges. No credit card is required at signup.

features.q1: How many transactions can I manage?
features.a1: It depends on your plan. Starter allows 3 active transactions, Solo 10, Pro 25, and Agency is unlimited. Archived transactions don't count toward the limit.
features.a2: When you create a transaction with the property profile filled in, Ofra automatically analyzes the type (residential, condo, land), context (rural, urban), and financing to generate relevant conditions. 52 templates are available.
features.a3: The 8-step workflow is standardized to ensure compliance and consistency. However, conditions are fully customizable and you can add manual conditions at any step.
features.q4: How does the external offer form work?
features.a4: You generate a secure link from a transaction. The collaborating agent fills in the form online with the offer details, and it appears directly in your transaction for review.

billing.a1: Yes, all displayed prices are in Canadian dollars (CAD). No hidden fees, no surprises.
billing.a2: Yes, you can upgrade at any time. The change takes effect immediately. To downgrade, you may need to archive active transactions to meet the new limit.
billing.a3: No. All plans are monthly with no commitment. You can cancel at any time. No cancellation fees, no penalties.

security.a1: Yes. Ofra uses HTTPS/TLS encryption for all communications, passwords are hashed with bcrypt, and sessions use HTTP-only cookies. Your data is hosted in Canada.
security.a2: Ofra integrates FINTRAC compliance tools directly into the workflow: identity verification, funds source confirmation, and complete traceability. The tool facilitates your compliance but does not replace your legal responsibility as an agent.
security.q3: Who has access to my transactions?
security.a3: By default, only you have access to your transactions. You can share access with specific collaborators with granular permissions (read-only, edit). Agency administrators can have an overview if applicable.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.q1: Can I try Ofra before paying?
faq.a1: Yes! All new accounts get 30 days free with all Pro features. No credit card required.
faq.a2: Absolutely. There are no long-term contracts. Cancel your subscription anytime from your account settings.
faq.a3: Yes, we use industry-standard encryption and security practices. Your data is stored securely in Canada.
faq.a4: The first 25 agents to join Ofra get a lifetime price lock — the price you choose will never increase, even if our rates go up.
